title: Capacitor - compare pd when plate area doubles

content.question: A parallel-plate capacitor has plates of area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> that are separated by a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>. Each plate has a charge of magnitude <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>, and the potential difference between the plates is <math alttext="delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. A second parallel-plate capacitor has plates of area <math alttext="2 A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>A</mi></math> that are separated by the same distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>. In the second capacitor, each plate has a charge of the same magnitude <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>, and the potential difference between the plates is <math alttext="delta V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is <math alttext="delta V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="one fourth delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
